sentences: Ta on olnud väga töökas siiani.
Kuni siiani pole me midagi teada saanud.
context: The Estonian word 'siiani' is an adverb that means 'so far', 'until now', or 'up to this point'. It refers to a period of time extending from some past point until the present moment. This word is commonly used in sentences to indicate what has happened up to the current time, similar to how English speakers use phrases like 'so far' or 'until now'.
